page.title: 16OLD HOUSES
page.content: {OLD HOUSES. Old houses around our area were mainly built around the sixteenth century.They originally comprised of four rooms.The two downstairs were for cattle as the main income was farming. The upstairs rooms were for living and sleeping accomodation. Up until the eighteent century all of these houses were thatched,butthe thatching had to be replaced every onehundred years because of rotting.Thatching has now been replaced by slate which is longer lasting. These houses were built out of old Guernsey Granite which is still used to give modern houses the traditional Guernsey finish.As Granite is so hard most of the old Guernsey farmhouses remaine intact and perfectly safe.
